qas.question: How long before Eisenhower was to be transferred to France did World War I end?
What decoration did Eisenhower receive as a result of his First World War service?
What notable Second World War commander disparaged Eisenhower for his lack of combat experience?

context: Once again his spirits were raised when the unit under his command received orders overseas to France. This time his wishes were thwarted when the armistice was signed, just a <a0_0>week<a0_0/> before departure. Completely missing out on the warfront left him depressed and bitter for a time, despite being given the <a1_0>Distinguished Service Medal<a1_0/> for his work at home.[citation needed] In World War II, rivals who had combat service in the first great war (led by Gen. Bernard <a2_0>Montgomery<a2_0/>) sought to denigrate Eisenhower for his previous lack of combat duty, despite his stateside experience establishing a camp, completely equipped, for thousands of troops, and developing a full combat training schedule.
